The scene app is the main managing tool for GMs. The GM can see all the current tags & statues for the current scene next to all the characters and their selected tags & statuses.

Opening the Scene App

Shortcut: Ctl+J or Journal Notes -> Scene Tags

Open Journal Notes on the left side and then click on the scroll icon which appears in the second row. The icon is called "Scene Tags" if you hover over the icon.

Adding Tags & Statuses from Challenges As Dice Roll Modifiers

You can add tags & statuses to the scene app by clicking on a tag or status in the Tags & Status section from a challenge on the left side to add them as dice roll modifiers.

Drag'N'Drop of Tags & Statuses from a challenge to the scene app or character

You can drag'n'drop tags & statuses from the Threats & Consequences of challenge to the scene app

Almost all import functions of this system display a short help text while hovering them with the mouse.

If you find bugs feel free to contact us via the GitHub issues page or via discord. Either per DM or in the #vtt section of the Sons Of Oak discord server.

Recommended FoundryVTT modules

Dice So Nice!

Tokenizer: The Token Editor

Fellowship Themebooks are special. They are technically a seperate actor which all users from the fellowship have ownership.

1. Create an actor of the type "Fellowship Themecard"

2. Give all fellowship characters(users) ownership to the fellowship themecard (actor)

3 Assign characters to their corresponding user

Do not forget to assign the characters to their corresponding users. Do NOT assign the fellowship themecard actor, just the character of the user.

After setting up the character assignment and after a reload / or relogin of the users, they will see the fellowship themecard in their charactersheet.

The roll dialog is reactive. This means you can open the roll dialog by clicking on one of the three roll types (e.G. Quick Roll). Now you can (de)select tags & statuses from your character sheet and they will get added or removed from the roll dialog.

The same applies for the GM when adding or removing tags & statuses from the scene.

The system comes with all themebooks from the core rule book but without the power tag questions from the books. See core rule book page 92.

The power tag questions are completly optional. You don't need to enter any of them to be able to use the system. Son of Oak will provide commercial foundry modules in the future containing all themebooks prefilled.

Drag and drop a themebook from the provided LiTM Themebooks compendium pack in your character. Open the edit mode of the character by clicking on the top left lock icon. Now you can enter all your powertags in the themebooks.

The checkbox next to a powertag entry is for checking the corresponding powertag as a planned powertag for the future. If you hover with the mouse over the checkbox you will see the corresponding help text.
